definitions.definition: that can be believed or trusted

examples.text: It is just not credible that she would cheat.
It seems barely credible that anyone could have walked so far in a day.
You need imagination to make what you write fully credible.
It seemed to be a credible account of events.
There's only one credible witness in the case.
They haven't yet come up with a credible explanation.

definitions.definition: that can be accepted, because it seems possible that it could be successful

examples.text: Community service is seen as the only credible alternative to imprisonment.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin credibilis, from credere ‘believe’.
